<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of ignore_sigpipe:
```c
static void
ignore_sigpipe (void)
{
  struct sigaction oldsig;
  struct sigaction sig;

  sig.sa_handler = &catcher;
  sigemptyset (&sig.sa_mask);
#ifdef SA_INTERRUPT
  sig.sa_flags = SA_INTERRUPT;  /* SunOS */
#else
  sig.sa_flags = SA_RESTART;
#endif
  if (0 != sigaction (SIGPIPE, &sig, &oldsig))
    fprintf (stderr,
             "Failed to install SIGPIPE handler: %s\n", strerror (errno));
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function ignore_sigpipe:
static void
catcher (int sig)
{
  (void) sig;  /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */
  /* do nothing */
}
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
struct sigaction oldsig;
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: The declaration 'struct sigaction oldsig;' is at the start of the function ignore_sigpipe and is executed on function entry (i.e. it is reachable whenever the function is called). There are no prior control-flow statements that prevent execution to that point, so this fragment does not constitute unreachable code. (An unused local variable would be a different concern, but not a violation of MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1.)
